required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multi-Treatment PNN Modulation for Chronic Rhinitis
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Study of Multi-Treatment Posterior Nasal Nerve (PNN) Modulation for Treatment of Chronic Rhinitis

brief_summary.textblock: Feasibility of treatment at multiple sites with the ClariFix cryoablation device for treatment of chronic rhinitis

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Prospective, non-randomized, feasibility study of multi-treatment locations

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Procedure-related Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) and/or Serious Adverse Device Effects (SADE)
primary_outcome.description: The outcome measure is the number of participants experiencing 1 or more SAEs/SADEs.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day of treatment during procedure and for up to 1 hour post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Tolerability of treatment as provided by the participant by verbal report of pain/discomfort during treatment and post treatment using an 11-point scale indicating pain intensity from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Reflective Total Nasal Symptom Score (rTNSS)
secondary_outcome.description: The rTNSS is a validated patient-reported outcome measure consisting of 4 symptoms: rhinorrhea, nasal congestion, nasal itching, and sneezing. Each item is scored on a scale of 0 (no symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms). The total rTNSS is the sum of the 4 symptom scores and has a possible range of 0 to 12 points. The change from baseline is calculated as the follow-up value minus the baseline value. Negative values indicate improved symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Overall Nasal Obstruction Symptom Evaluation (NOSE) Score
secondary_outcome.description: The NOSE survey is a patient-reported outcome measure consisting of 5 nasal symptoms: nasal congestion or stuffiness, nasal blockage or obstruction, trouble breathing through the nose, trouble sleeping, and unable to get enough air through the nose during exercise or exertion. Each symptom is scored using a 5-point scale of 0 (not a problem) to 4 (severe problem). The 5 symptom scores are summed and the total is multiplied by 5 to give a total score that ranges from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating worse symptoms. The change from baseline is calculated as the follow-up value minus the baseline value. Negative values indicate improved symptoms.

arm_group.description: Cryotherapy of the posterior nasal nerve using the ClariFix device

intervention.description: The ClariFixâ„¢ device (K162608) is an FDA 510(k) cleared Class II cryosurgical tool indicated for the destruction of unwanted tissue during surgical procedures, including in adults with chronic rhinitis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Presence of moderate to severe rhinorrhea symptoms and mild to severe nasal congestion symptoms for >3 months.
- Documented allergy test within the last 10 years that defines whether or not subject has allergies to perennial and seasonal allergens, or is willing to have one performed prior to study exit.
- Able to provide informed consent and willing to complete study activities and visits per protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically significant anatomic obstructions that limit access to the posterior nose.
- Prior sinus or nasal surgery that significantly alters the anatomy of the posterior nose.
- Moderate to severe ocular symptoms as determined.
- History of epistaxis in the past 3 months.
- History of rhinitis medicamentosa.
- Prior head or neck irradiation.
- Active or chronic nasal or sinus infection.
- Pregnant.
- Allergy or intolerance to anesthetic agent.
- Cryoglobulinemia, paroxysmal cold hemoglobinuria, cold urticaria, Raynaud's disease, and/or, open and/or infected wounds at or near the target tissue.
- Currently participating in another clinical research study.
- Any physical condition that, in the investigator's opinion, would prevent adequate study participation or pose increased risk.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected through the study duration of 90 day after the ClariFix procedure.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
